byline.original: By HELENE COOPER and GARDINER HARRIS

abstract: Gen Martin E Dempsey tells Senate Armed Services Committee that although nuclear deal with Iran will not prevent all dangers, it is still best way to relieve risk of military conflict between US and Iran;  hearing, at which Sec of State John Kerry spoke, gave Senate Republicans who support resolution to disapprove pact their first chance to publicly question top military officials on the agreement.
lead_paragraph: Gen. Martin E. Dempsey, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, told a Senate committee that the diplomatic approach to relieving the risk of a nuclear conflict was the right one.

headline.main: Top General Gives ‘Pragmatic’ View of Iran Nuclear Deal
headline.print_headline: Top General Gives ‘Pragmatic’ View of Iran Deal

snippet: Gen. Martin E. Dempsey, the chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, told a Senate committee that the diplomatic approach to relieving the risk of a nuclear conflict was the right one.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
